bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, June 30, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 30, 1894.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU RECEIVED AUG 7 94 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 24, 1894.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your No. 8, of the 15th alt, calling my attention to the Circular of the Department of September 19, 1893, dispensing with certain returns, which will be observed in the future.
I have the honor to be Sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul.
